style.name: American-Style Stout
style.description: Initial low to medium malt sweetness with a degree of caramel, chocolate and/or roasted coffee flavor with a distinctive dryroasted bitterness in the finish. Coffee-like roasted barley and roasted malt aromas are prominent. Some slight roasted malt acidity is permissible and a medium- to full-bodied mouthfeel is appropriate. Hop bitterness may be moderate to high. Hop aroma and flavor is moderate to high, often with American citrus-type and/or resiny hop character. The perception of fruity esters is low. Roasted malt/barley astringency may be low but not excessive. Diacetyl (butterscotch) should be negligible or not perceived. Head retention is excellent.

breweries.name: The Dayton Beer Company
breweries.description:
The Dayton Beer Company is a multiple Award Winning Brewery and was voted  Dayton’s Best Microbrewery in 2014.  Our Pilot Brewery and Taproom is located in Kettering, Ohio.  We are in the process of opening our Production Brewery and Bier Hall in Downtown Dayton.

We are proud to be the first true Microbrewery in the Dayton area in over 50 years. All of our beer is hand-crafted with no automation in small batches with our own unique recipes. This allows us to create beers tailored with our own vision and style.

The Dayton Beer Company remembers all those who came before us and treasure their legacy by naming our core brews after them. Be sure to look for us at your favorite watering holes and retailers. As always, we encourage everyone to stop by our brewery to enjoy the fruits of our labor and relax and have fun in our cozy tap-room.

style.name: American-Style Stout

Hop bitterness may be moderate to high. Hop aroma and flavor is moderate to high, often with American citrus-type and/or resiny hop character. The perception of fruity esters is low. Roasted malt/barley astringency may be low but not excessive. Diacetyl (butterscotch) should be negligible or not perceived. Head retention is excellent.

breweries.name: Mashcraft  Brewing
breweries.description: We are happy to bring a variety of consistently great ales and lagers to all of our neighbors in Central Indiana. Brewing and serving from our Greenwood tap room, we strive to provide high-quality and hand-crafted beers for everyone to enjoy.

data.name: Java Stout
data.description: Java Stout uses a custom blend of coffee beans, roasted locally for us by Water Street Coffee Joint, to generate its intense flavor. Possessing an unmistakable aromatic punch, Java Stout has long been one of our most popular stouts.
data.foodPairings:
Pair Java Stout with spicy foods like Indian, Ethiopian or Szechuan.

For dessert, go with chocolate noir cake, espresso milk chocolate or cheesecake with raspberries.

Pairs well with cheeses like mascarpone, Stilton, feta, Parmesan and Roquefort.

breweries.name: Bell's Brewery, Inc.
breweries.description: Bell's Brewery, Inc. began in 1985 with a quest for better beer and a 15 gallon soup kettle. Since then, we've grown into a regional craft brewery that employs more than 200 people over an 20 state area, in addition to Puerto Rico and Washington DC. The dedication to brewing flavorful, unfiltered, quality craft beers that started in 1985 is still with us today. We currently brew over 20 beers for distribution as well as many other small batch beers that are served at our pub in Kalamazoo, the Eccentric Cafe. Our ongoing goal is to brew thoughtfully, creatively and artistically. We strive to bring an authentic and pleasant experience to all of our customers through our unique ales and beers.

data.name: Java Stout
data.description: A hearty filling stout that is sure to please. Brewed with the same fantastic coffee beans that make the coffee at Sue's the best around. Also brewed with 2 different types of chocolate and oatmeal. I know what you're thinking.... and yes it's even great to make a stout float out of. 8% abv and chock full of deliciousness. Enjoy!!

breweries.name: Bella Casa di Vino
breweries.description: Bella Casa di Vino is a winery and micro-brewery located in St. Clair Michigan, serving our own wine and craft beer since 2009.

data.name: Java the Stout
data.description: A caramel centered stout accentuated by Athens' Own Dawn Chorus French Roast. I first brew a stout with minimal roasted barley, no black malt and an abundant amount of caramel malts (Special B, cara 8) this creates a sweet flavor and mouth feel to boot!  After fermentation the beer is cold conditioned on 4lbs of course ground coffee beans for 1 week. The coffee beans add color to the stout and lots of roasted flavor. Java The Stout not only contains approximately a half a cup of coffee caffeine per pint but is also 6.5% abv. Great body with the robust aroma and flavor of coffee, what more could you ask for.

breweries.name: Jackie O's Pub and Brewery
breweries.description: Jackie O's Pub and Brewery prides itself in creating neo-traditional handcrafted artisan ales. Inside each pint, a fusion of American craft brewing creativity and historically sound techniques await your palate. A marriage of exploration and tradition guaranteed to cure whatever ales you!

breweries.name: Lazy Magnolia Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Founded in September of 2003, Lazy Magnolia is Mississippi's first brewery offering locally brewed beer to Mississippians and visitors to our state at all of their favorite restaurants. Located in the Bootleg capital of Mississippi, we break with tradition by offering legal brew to our customers!

Lazy Magnolia is dedicated to providing the best possible products through our tireless efforts, our superior motivation, and our Southern heritage. We offer our customers a line of refreshing beverages, made in true Southern Style, complementing the traditions of the South and remaining true to Southern tastes.

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation: Every Saturday at 10:30am. No reservation required.  After the tour, we'll give you a list of great local places to try our beer! No beer samples at the brewery. It's the law, in Mississippi anyway.

data.name: Jemmy American Stout
data.description:
A dark stout, yet with light body and creamy head. 

Stouts are full-bodied black ales with flavors of dark roasted coffee and chocolate. Ours is made with Crisp Marris Otter malt, a bit of wheat for smoothness, Perle and Centennial hops and American ale yeast.

data.name: Jingle Java Holiday Stout
data.description: Fans of our Uncommon Stout will love Jingle Java! This coffee stout is enhanced with vanilla, pecan, cinnamon, caramel and rum to give it a flavor that is perfect for the holiday season!

data.name: Jive Espresso Stout
data.description: Jive is made for those who enjoy life at a more deliberate pace. The earthy-ness of this beer is a tribute to the rich experience of a slow hike in the woods and drinking deeply from nature. Strong and steady malt tones, a subtle coffee and chocolate nose and hops entertain your tongue as you wander down the path. Cheers!

breweries.name: Two Beers Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Two Beers Brewing Company is a microbrewery located in SoDo that distributes to Bars and Restaurants. Our tasting room is open 3-7pm Thursday and Friday.

Our Mission is to provide the finest beverages to the discerning drinkers of the Pacific Northwest

data.name: Jo Jo’s Midnight Stout
data.description: Don’t be afraid of the dark! This stout pays homage to JoJo’s Café, housed in your brewpub from 1937 – 1996. An unsubstantiated rumor has it that JoJo, along with a few former JoJo’s Café regulars, still haunt our humble pub…mostly around midnight, of course. This mysterious stout is black as, well, midnight. A little smokiness adds depth to the espresso, lactose, and milk chocolate that already inhabit this light engulfing beer. The 7.2% ABV assures that warmth and subtle sweetness will reward your taste buds and guide them safely on their happy journey.

breweries.name: Newburyport Brewing Company
breweries.description: Founded in 2012, the Company is Massachusetts' only exclusive all-can and keg craft brewery. Co-founded by two local Newburyport entrepreneurs, musicians, and home brewers - Chris Webb and Bill Fisher - the company aims to capture the essence of Newburyport's quaint seaside character across a line of great tasting handcrafted ales. Newburyport Brewing Company uses premium quality natural ingredients in its Newburyport Pale Ale™, Plum Island Belgian White™, Green Head IPA™ and 1635 Series™ beers.

breweries.name: Pecan Street Brewing
breweries.description:
Pecan Street Brewing and Restaurant — a place to visit with old friends and make new ones! We are located in Johnson City, in the heart of the scenic Texas Hill Country, at 106 E. Pecan — directly across from the historic Courthouse.

We feature hand-crafted beers brewed on premise for the freshest beer you can drink! And for your friends who might prefer a glass of wine, we also have Texas Wines! 

Our menu includes brick oven pizzas, burgers and more, using fresh and local ingredients.

There is live music every Friday and Saturday night, with Sunday being the open mic night!

breweries.name: Carolina Brewery
breweries.description:
Carolina Brewery is a locally-owned brewery and restaurant that has drawn international attention for its handcrafted beers, Our award-winning signature beers include Flagship IPA (Gold Medal, Great American Beer Festival), Copperline Amber Ale (Gold Medal, World Beer Championships), Sky Blue Golden Ale (Silver Medal, World Beer Championships), and Oatmeal Porter. We also offer a rotating list of seasonal brews. Our beers are now available on tap and in growlers and cans throughout North Carolina, so ask for them by name at your favorite bar, restaurant, or grocery store!

At our brewpubs in Chapel Hill and Pittsboro NC, you’ll discover authentic tastes in the glass and on the plate, a casual yet upscale atmosphere and affordable prices. Whether you’re looking for a place to grab a fresh beer with friends, enjoy a delicious meal, or host your next party, you’ve come to the right place. Carolina Brewery has been voted Best Brewpub in the Southeast by Brewpub magazine, and Best Burger in the Triangle by Independent Magazine and the readers of The Daily Tar Heel. But above all, we value the opinions of our customers, who cast their vote every time they return to our restaurant. We hope to see you soon. Cheers!

Proudly owned and operated by UNC alumni!

Fort Collins Brewery & Tavern is a family-owned, handcrafted microbrewery and full service tavern in Northern Colorado, established in 2003. FCB offers an outstanding line up of 50 ales and lagers that can be found on tap as well as in bottles throughout the U.S. For more information, visit fortcollinsbrewery.com or call 970-472-1499.

breweries.name: Salt Creek Brewery
breweries.description:
Salt Creek Brewery in Bedford, Indiana is Lawrence County's first and only craft brewery. Located in a comfortable and uniquely converted service garage north of Bedford on East Trogdon Lane.

This state of the art brewery was once a popular service garage. The former "alignment pit" at Salt Creek Brewery now serves as what may be the only open pit brewery in the U.S.

Our goal is that each time you visit or taproom, their is a beer available that you haven't tasted before.

breweries.name: Willimantic Brewing Company
breweries.description: Our original Main Street Café was founded in 1991, and began operations as a small deli in the old Capitol Theatre building on Main Street in Willimantic, CT. Occupying both the lobby and concession area of the theatre, seating was limited to 50 people. After 3 years we were bursting at the seams and made the move to 877 Main Street, another historic building. There we expanded to a full service restaurant and featured American craft-brewed beers and an extensive menu.

breweries.name: Daredevil Brewing Co.
breweries.description:
Daredevil Brewing Co. is an independent, Indianapolis based craft brewery that was founded by two award winning craft brewers, Bill Ballinger and Michael Pearson, and a talented craft beer enthusiast, Shane Pearson. We know from experience that brewing eclectic, aggressively fun beers is not for the timid. Fortunately, the only thing we like better than a challenge is drinking the end result.

Daredevil Brewing Co operates a state of the art production craft brewery built in the heart of the Indianapolis metro area. The brewery is located on a 2.0-acre site at 1151 Main Street in Speedway just five blocks from the Indianapolis Motor Speedway while also being just minutes from downtown and easily accessible from anywhere in the metro area by car, public transit and bicycles. The taproom at Daredevil Brewing Co provides a welcoming atmosphere for guests to visit, take a brewery tour, enjoy a pint or pick up Daredevil beers to go.

data.name: Kaktus Oyster Stout
data.description: This smooth dry stout is brewed with Black and Chocolate malts and then steeped with 4 dozen full shell oysters per batch. This beer will put lead in your pencil!

breweries.name: Kaktus Brewing Company
breweries.description:
This is a nano-brewery 
​​Producing 500 barrels yearly 
With 6-to-8 beers on tap

We shipped in German Made equipment to set ourselves apart in the local industry allowing us to specialize in lighter style lager beers while keeping the favorites such as Porter's, ESB's, IPA's and other classic Ales.  
​​
​O​ur reverse osmosis water purifier allows us to control the quality of water during each and every brew. ​​​
​
​Mike Waddy, our brew master, has over years of experience creating beer recipes and hand crafting beers consumed by many New Mexican beer enthusiasts.

​Mike Waddy, our brew master, has over years of experience creating beer recipes and hand crafting beers consumed by many New Mexican beer enthusiasts.

breweries.name: Kaktus Brewing Company
breweries.description:
This is a nano-brewery 
​​Producing 500 barrels yearly 
With 6-to-8 beers on tap

We shipped in German Made equipment to set ourselves apart in the local industry allowing us to specialize in lighter style lager beers while keeping the favorites such as Porter's, ESB's, IPA's and other classic Ales.  
​​
​O​ur reverse osmosis water purifier allows us to control the quality of water during each and every brew. ​​​
​
​Mike Waddy, our brew master, has over years of experience creating beer recipes and hand crafting beers consumed by many New Mexican beer enthusiasts.

data.description: Dark, thick, reamy and slightly sweet, this stout is brewed with Caramel, Chocolate, roasted Black and Briess 2 Row Pale Malt. Northern Brewer and Tattnanger hops are used to compliment the sweetness and malty flavor.

breweries.name: Northwoods Brewpub and Grill
breweries.description:
Northwoods Brewpub and Grill brought the fine tradition of craft brewing to Eau Claire. Now the first microbrewery in west central Wisconsin is the place to be!

It’s all woodsy and warm in our lodge-like bar. Hang out with friends, shoot pool for free or melt into the comfy chairs in the lounge. Whether you want to let loose, play trivia or have an intimate conversation there’s a spot waiting for you. Did we mention the 14 tap beers? Your thirst stops here.

breweries.name: Dungeness Brewing
breweries.description: Dungeness Brewing is the start of a dream...

data.name: Kelp Stout
data.description: If there’s one sentiment that’s constantly repeated among craft beer drinkers it is, “This beer is good but it needs more seaweed!” If we’ve heard it once, we’ve heard it a thousand times. Well folks, message received. Tofino Brewing Company presents to you the Kelp Stout. A dark, rich, full-bodied ale brewed with locally harvested Kelp, giving a unique, umami-type quality to this complex beer.

data.name: Kentucky Girl
data.description: What can I say about this stout? Even thinking of this stout makes my mind go blank due to how incredible this beer is. We stashed a keg of this beer away waiting for the right time and what a better time then stout month. We took our Coffee Girl Stout and put it into Four Roses Bourbon Barrels and let it sit for two months. What came out of the barrels was…unnaturally delicious. The combination of bourbon and coffee with this amazing stout is nothing short of paradise. Drink it while you can there is only one more keg left!

breweries.name: Fort George Brewery
breweries.description: The Fort George Brewery + Public House was the original settlement site of Astoria founded in March 1811 by Captain Jonathan Thorn. In its heyday, Astoria was the Pacific Fur Company's primary fur trading post in the Northwest. Under temporary British authority it was renamed Fort George after King George the 3rd. In 1924 the Fort George Building was erected to house an automotive repair facility until the late 1990's. Briefly abandoned and sadly neglected, the Fort George building has been recently revitalized as a home to the Blue Schorcher Bakery and our brewpub. We are honored to play a part in the Fort and Astoria's renaissance.

data.name: Keyboard Warrior
data.description:
Brewed for those who rate all things on the Internet. We built an American Stout with lots of roast, moderate bitterness and a pleasant alcohol warmth to help you pen your next “raving” review. You know who you are!
:|

breweries.name: Barley Brothers Restaurant & Brewery
breweries.description:
Barley Brothers restaurant and brewery is an upscale-casual eatery known for its extensive menu, great music, and award winning draft beer. From classic lagers to more obscure ales and stouts there's a draft beer flavor for everyone. Our American cuisine menu includes an impressive selection of appetizers, salads, pastas, sandwiches, wood fired pizzas, ribs and rotisserie chicken. Barley Brothers plays America’s favorite - classic rock and an abundance of flat screens showcase the day's sports and special events.

Barley Brothers is part of the Shugrues Restaurant and Brewery Group. Restaurants are located Lake Havasu City, and Sedona Arizona.

There is something for everyone at the Barley Brothers.

data.name: Kilgore
data.description: An American Stout brewed with rye malt for a silky body. Kilgore is brewed with British roasted barley and chocolate malts for a roasty backbone with notes of coffee and cocoa. Hopped with Chinook, Columbus, Centennial, and Cascade hops for a citrusy Pacific Northwest punch.

breweries.name: Beachwood BBQ & Brewing
breweries.description:
At Beachwood BBQ & Brewing we take craft beer very seriously. As downtown Long Beach’s only independent craft brewery, we strive to make sure our passion for craft beer shines through with every sip.

Our award-winning Brewmaster, Julian Shrago, spends countless hours perfecting each recipe, researching new ones, and pushing the boundaries of craft beer brewing today. Our general philosophy on brewing is to always think of flavor first. No matter how creative you want to be, beer, much like food, must taste good (or hopefully outstanding).

We brew a wide variety of American styles, as well as some traditional British, German, and Belgian-style beers. Having a large variety of beers keeps customers excited and creates a sense of adventure associated with the brand. It also allows us to have unlimited creative freedom, and that always keeps things fresh. Cheers!

breweries.name: Bell's Brewery, Inc.
breweries.description: Bell's Brewery, Inc. began in 1985 with a quest for better beer and a 15 gallon soup kettle. Since then, we've grown into a regional craft brewery that employs more than 200 people over an 20 state area, in addition to Puerto Rico and Washington DC. The dedication to brewing flavorful, unfiltered, quality craft beers that started in 1985 is still with us today. We currently brew over 20 beers for distribution as well as many other small batch beers that are served at our pub in Kalamazoo, the Eccentric Cafe. Our ongoing goal is to brew thoughtfully, creatively and artistically. We strive to bring an authentic and pleasant experience to all of our customers through our unique ales and beers.

data.name: Kulshan Brewing Company
data.description: An export-style stout brewed with beechwood smoked malt, creating a dynamic smoked stout. Allow yourself to be transported back to the days when all beer had a smoky character due to the malting process of barley and the fuels of the age. Rich, sharp, clean and an earthy smoky character complete this beer. So enjoy it fireside, amongst the trees as snow falls, or best of all with a meal prepared over wood stoked flames.

breweries.name: Lake Placid Pub & Brewery
breweries.description:
It began, like many microbreweries, with a homebrew kit and a love of beer. Not just a love of drinking beer but a real respect for the craft, the history, the art, and the industry, as well as a love for the brewing process itself. Today, Lake Placid Pub & Brewery has been brewing award-winning ales for 14 years and has expanded rapidly due to its popularity and quality, earning the respect of the brewing community.

In 1996, Christopher Ericson and a college friend purchased P.J. O'Neill's, a pub in the small, Adirondack village of Lake Placid. They renovated the upstairs into a pub and restaurant, installed a seven barrel brewery, and began brewing. Chris' brewing experience included Federal Jack's / Shipyard Brewing in Kennebunkport, ME and The Shed Restaurant and Brewery in Stowe, VT.  The Lake Placid Pub & Brewery soon became a popular spot both for locals and visitors to the Lake Placid area.

data.name: Lake Trout Stout
data.description: Lake Trout Stout is midnight black with a thick and creamy head. It is a full bodied stout brewed with oatmeal and plenty of hops to balance the roasted barley. Our stout is an experience. It tastes the same way it looks - dark and rich. It is named after the famous deep water Sebago Lake Togue or Lake Trout which inhabit the depths of Maine's deepest lake. Enjoy.
data.foodPairings: rich sauces, grilled meats, or chocolate

breweries.name: Sebago Brewing Company
breweries.description: At Sebago Brewing Company we brew our beers from all malt. We use American grown 2-Row, caramel, chocolate, black, roasted barley and Munich malts from Briess Malting Company. Our grain silo holds 50,000 lbs. of American 2-Row Pale malt. We purchase our grain by the truckload and the bulk grain is blown into the silo from the grain truck. We use 75-80% of this grain in all of our beers. Then we measure our specialty malts into the mill. At this point we crush the malt so that the husk's are cracked open and the "meat" of the grain is exposed.

data.name: Libation Propaganda Coffee Stout
data.description: This award winning coffee stout is an exercise in balance. Black malt mellows out a textbook stout dryness.  Carmel and toffee notes shine through.  Chocolate malt is replaced by locally roasted coffee, and our finishing hop adds a complementary floral note. Dedicated to a different local cause every year (Surfrider CT) it’s propaganda worth spreading.

data.name: Liborator Stout – Private Reserve
data.description:
Our “Private Reserve” Stout is carefully brewed using 6 noble malts from England plus oatmeal to provide body and a silky palate.  Expect highly complex notes of Dark Chocolate, Coffee, Nuts and a slight hint of black licorice.  Wish us luck at this year’s World Beer Championships in Munich, Germany.  Together with our Pacific Pioneer Porter (Top 5 Finish last year!) we will be entering the Liberator Stout.

This Stout is a celebration of 30 years of my brewing passion. Ideal with Irish Stew, Cottage Pie or Bangers and Mash.  Don’t be shy in using it enrich a fine dark sauce while cooking! The ideal beer to enjoy with a fine Cigar!

Brewed only 2x per year.

style.name: American-Style Stout
style.description: Initial low to medium malt sweetness with a degree of caramel, chocolate and/or roasted coffee flavor with a distinctive dryroasted bitterness in the finish. Coffee-like roasted barley and roasted malt aromas are prominent. Some slight roasted malt acidity is permissible and a medium- to full-bodied mouthfeel is appropriate. Hop bitterness may be moderate to high. Hop aroma and flavor is moderate to high, often with American citrus-type and/or resiny hop character. The perception of fruity esters is low. breweries.name: Sudwerk
breweries.description: Sudwerk brews and bottles Swiss Beer in Zürich Oberland.  Unlike others that brew “Pale Ale Style”  Our beer is brewed on an Authentic British Pale Ale Brew House using the finest English Pale Ale Malt, American Hops and Yeast.  I have been brewing American Pale Ales since 1982, back in the days when I brewed 20 Liters at a time as a homebrewer.  Today I brew 2000 Liters at a time (more friends then back then).  I grew up in Northern California during the Microbrewery Revolution and you will taste that in my beers. Of course I never pasteurize our beers or add anything artificial.  Trust me when I say, Beer coming from Pfäffikon to your dinner table will taste fresher than beer brought in a container traveling 2 months over the ocean.  Don’t just take our word for it, Biergenuss Magazine calls us “The Rothschild of Beer”. Thanks to all of you for making Western Rider the number one selling Pale Ale in Switzerland. Unlike many other brands, we are not brewed in Germany or in another Kanton and then sold as a “Local” or “Swiss Beer”. We are also not a big beer factory, owned by a European neighbor.  With every Sudwerk Beer, you are enjoying an Authentic Pale Ale produced here in Switzerland, by a family owned and operated “Kleinbrauerei”/Microbrewery. With every Sudwerk Beer, you enjoy the true meaning of Swiss Quality and the results of good old fashioned hard work.  You can find us in larger COOP Stores in the German and French speaking parts of Switzerland, on the Bahnhofstrasse in Jelmoli, Rio Getränke, Drinks of the World as well as in over 100 Restaurants and Hotels. In Zürich, we are distributed by Heineken Distribution, Intercomestibles AG and Schatt Getränke. Quality without compromise. If you are ever in the neighborhood, come by and visit us!  And do follow us on Twitter and Facebook.

available.name: Year Round
available.description: Available year round as a staple beer.

style.name: American-Style Stout
style.description: Initial low to medium malt sweetness with a degree of caramel, chocolate and/or roasted coffee flavor with a distinctive dryroasted bitterness in the finish. Coffee-like roasted barley and roasted malt aromas are prominent. Some slight roasted malt acidity is permissible and a medium- to full-bodied mouthfeel is appropriate. Hop bitterness may be moderate to high. Hop aroma and flavor is moderate to high, often with American citrus-type and/or resiny hop character. The perception of fruity esters is low. Roasted malt/barley astringency may be low but not excessive. Diacetyl (butterscotch) should be negligible or not perceived. Head retention is excellent.

breweries.name: Barrier Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Barrier Brewing Co. is a 1bbl brewery operated by Evan Klein and Craig Frymark located in Oceanside, NY. The focus is small scale production of a breadth of styles and flavors brewed for the local market. The first batches were released to the public in June 2010.

"Brewing For Quality Not Quantity"

data.name: Like No Udder
data.description: A sweet stout dark in color that pours with a brownish, white fluffy head. Tastes of coffee, milk chocolate and roast play on the tongue as the beer finishes with a soft sweetness from the addition of flaked oats in the mash and dehydrated milk sugar in the boil kettle.

available.name: Seasonal
available.description: Available at the same time of year, every year.

style.name: American-Style Stout
style.description: Initial low to medium malt sweetness with a degree of caramel, chocolate and/or roasted coffee flavor with a distinctive dryroasted bitterness in the finish. Coffee-like roasted barley and roasted malt aromas are prominent. Some slight roasted malt acidity is permissible and a medium- to full-bodied mouthfeel is appropriate. Hop bitterness may be moderate to high. Hop aroma and flavor is moderate to high, often with American citrus-type and/or resiny hop character. The perception of fruity esters is low. Roasted malt/barley astringency may be low but not excessive. Diacetyl (butterscotch) should be negligible or not perceived. Head retention is excellent.

breweries.name: Omaha Brewing Company
breweries.description:
When Dr. Robert E. Lee and family decided to start a brewing company in Omaha, GA, (Yes, Georgia) it wasn't only because we enjoy a good local brew, but because craft beer isn't prevalent enough in South Georgia.

With the ideas of family, friends and quality always on our minds, we wanted to make beer that people enjoy. Not just sometimes, but every time you look at the Omaha Brewery label, taste the foam and pour a glass.

Our Brewer Nick Fowler, formerly of Atlanta's Red Brick Brewery, uses only the best ingredients (And trust us, there won't be beer unless it's fresh) and a clean, consistent method to boil and ferment a beer the general himself would enjoy.

data.name: Lil Night Terror
data.description: The little summer brother of the "Night Terror". Similar to its relative, this beer holds a sweet, creamy body chased by dominant flavors of chocolate and almonds. However, unlike it's bigger brother, is much more sessionable with 4% ABV.

style.name: American-Style Stout
style.description: Initial low to medium malt sweetness with a degree of caramel, chocolate and/or roasted coffee flavor with a distinctive dryroasted bitterness in the finish. Coffee-like roasted barley and roasted malt aromas are prominent. Some slight roasted malt acidity is permissible and a medium- to full-bodied mouthfeel is appropriate. Hop bitterness may be moderate to high. Hop aroma and flavor is moderate to high, often with American citrus-type and/or resiny hop character. The perception of fruity esters is low. Roasted malt/barley astringency may be low but not excessive. Diacetyl (butterscotch) should be negligible or not perceived. Head retention is excellent.

breweries.name: LTD Brewing Co.
breweries.description: Using an 8 barrel brewing system makes us one of the smallest production breweries in Minnesota.  We focus on providing constant innovation and imagination to the craft beer enthusiast. Having a small, flexible system allows LTD Brewing to challenge the taste-buds of people who dream for a great beer. We are not bound by a style of beer, ingredients or a predetermined idea of what a beer drinker would expect. We are committed to re-inventing the way beer is brewed and providing an experience, not a drink.

breweries.name: Sand Creek Brewing Company
breweries.description:
The Sand Creek Brewing Company began on a dairy farm in Downing, Wisconsin, about 20 miles northwest of the city of Menomonie. After homebrewing on the family farm for years, homebrewer Cory Schroeder teamed up with Jim Wiesender to found the brewery in 1999.

Using equipment scrounged from various industries, such as a converted pudding tank for the brew kettle, the pair launched a successful business, brewing the beer just steps away from the chicken coop and a busy dairy farm.

Their Sand Creek Golden Ale and English Style Special Ale, available only on draft and in half-gallon growlers, soon developed a reputation throughout Wisconsin's many brew fests. With a capacity of only about 150 barrels per year, the brewery, now with a third owner on board, quickly outgrew the little farm shed converted into a brewhouse.

Hoping to remain in the Dunn/St. Croix counties area, the company looked for a suitable place to relocate, but came up empty handed. Then opportunity knocked in the form of a phone call one evening from their friend in Black River Falls, Pioneer brewing's brewmaster Todd Krueger. The brewery was for sale.

In March of 2004 the combined forces of the two breweries officially formed the new Sand Creek Brewing Co. of Black River Falls, Wisconsin.

data.description: Infused with Cocoa Nibs, Vanilla Bean, & Lily Bean Coffee Extract
